titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The weather continues unseasonably warm, and tends again to be tempestuous. I read Robertson all the morning, & again before dinner.

It is amazingly difficult to frame a coherent notion of him. Evidently he chafed against his position. The fretting attentions of pious women must have exasperated and humiliated his essentially virile understanding. His letters are full of angry contempt for the preacher's work. I can understand this, being a preacher myself.
He felt a kind of loathing for Evangelism, while he disapproved Tractarianism
Nor would he suffer himself to be classed with the 'Christian Socialists'. His loneliness was absolute.
